content:
1
00:00:07,533 --> 00:00:09,599
I found that nothing in life

2
00:00:10,100 --> 00:00:11,466
is worthwhile

3
00:00:12,000 --> 00:00:13,700
unless you take risks

4
00:00:14,400 --> 00:00:15,200
nothing

5
00:00:16,366 --> 00:00:19,933
Nelson Mandela said there is no passion to be found

6
00:00:20,133 --> 00:00:21,466
playing small

7
00:00:21,866 --> 00:00:24,066
in settling for a life that's less

8
00:00:24,400 --> 00:00:26,566
than the one you're capable of living

9
00:00:27,300 --> 00:00:29,300
now I'm sure in your experiences in school

10
00:00:29,300 --> 00:00:30,866
and applying to college and

11
00:00:30,900 --> 00:00:31,766
picking your major

12
00:00:31,766 --> 00:00:33,366
and deciding what you want to do with

13
00:00:33,366 --> 00:00:35,533
like I'm sure people have told you

14
00:00:35,566 --> 00:00:37,866
to make sure you have something to fall back on

15
00:00:38,066 --> 00:00:40,166
make sure you got something to fall back on honey

16
00:00:41,333 --> 00:00:43,466
but I never understood that concept

17
00:00:43,866 --> 00:00:45,666
having something to fall back on

18
00:00:46,866 --> 00:00:48,333
if I'm going to fall

19
00:00:49,333 --> 00:00:51,499
I don't want to fall back on anything

20
00:00:51,900 --> 00:00:53,466
I want to fall forward

21
00:00:54,366 --> 00:00:55,533
I figure at least this way

22
00:00:55,533 --> 00:00:57,133
I'll see what I'm going to hit

23
00:00:59,333 --> 00:01:00,699
without consistency

24
00:01:01,300 --> 00:01:02,566
you'll never finish

25
00:01:04,500 --> 00:01:07,666
so do what you feel passionate about passionate about

26
00:01:08,100 --> 00:01:09,533
take chances

27
00:01:10,933 --> 00:01:12,366
don't be afraid to fail this

28
00:01:12,366 --> 00:01:15,199
an old IQ test was nine dots

29
00:01:15,566 --> 00:01:16,899
and you had to

30
00:01:16,966 --> 00:01:20,399
draw five lines with a pencil within these nine dots

31
00:01:21,200 --> 00:01:22,466
without lifting the pencil

32
00:01:22,933 --> 00:01:25,799
the only way to do it was to go outside the box

33
00:01:28,166 --> 00:01:29,566
don't be afraid to

34
00:01:30,133 --> 00:01:31,799
think outside the box

35
00:01:31,800 --> 00:01:34,333
don't be afraid to fail big

36
00:01:34,566 --> 00:01:37,899
to dream big but remember

37
00:01:39,166 --> 00:01:40,366
dreams

38
00:01:41,066 --> 00:01:42,399
without goals

39
00:01:43,466 --> 00:01:45,066
are just dreams

40
00:01:48,866 --> 00:01:51,899
Reggie Jackson struck out 2600 times in his career

41
00:01:51,900 --> 00:01:54,533
the most in the history of baseball

42
00:01:54,533 --> 00:01:56,466
but you don't hear about the strikeouts

43
00:01:56,466 --> 00:01:58,299
people remember the home runs

44
00:01:59,766 --> 00:02:00,899
fall forward

45
00:02:02,500 --> 00:02:05,766
Thomas Edison conducted 1000 failed experiments

46
00:02:05,766 --> 00:02:07,199
did you know that I didn't know that

47
00:02:08,800 --> 00:02:12,366
because the 1000 and 1st was the light bulb

48
00:02:14,266 --> 00:02:15,466
fall forward

49
00:02:16,933 --> 00:02:20,766
every failed experiment is one step closer to success

50
00:02:21,933 --> 00:02:23,533
you've got to take risks

51
00:02:23,533 --> 00:02:25,766
and I'm sure you've probably heard that before

52
00:02:25,766 --> 00:02:28,733
but I want to talk to you about why that's so important

53
00:02:32,400 --> 00:02:35,566
you will fail at some point in your life except it

54
00:02:35,700 --> 00:02:36,866
you will lose

55
00:02:37,500 --> 00:02:39,200
you will embarrass yourself

56
00:02:39,700 --> 00:02:41,733
you will suck at something

57
00:02:41,766 --> 00:02:43,166
there's no doubt about it

58
00:02:43,866 --> 00:02:44,966
and I know that's probably

59
00:02:44,966 --> 00:02:47,666
not a traditional message for a graduation ceremony

60
00:02:47,666 --> 00:02:48,466
but hey

61
00:02:48,566 --> 00:02:51,866
I'm telling you embrace it because it's inevitable

62
00:02:56,733 --> 00:02:58,866
in the acting business you fail all the time

63
00:02:58,866 --> 00:03:00,199
early on in my career

64
00:03:00,766 --> 00:03:03,666
I auditioned for a part in a Broadway musical

65
00:03:04,400 --> 00:03:05,966
perfect role for me I thought

66
00:03:06,566 --> 00:03:08,566
except for the fact that I can't sing

67
00:03:11,200 --> 00:03:12,333
I didn't get the job

68
00:03:16,066 --> 00:03:17,266
but here's the thing

69
00:03:18,600 --> 00:03:19,966
I didn't quit

70
00:03:21,466 --> 00:03:23,066
I didn't fall back

71
00:03:24,500 --> 00:03:27,133
I walked out of there to prepare for the next audition

72
00:03:27,133 --> 00:03:28,199
and the next audition

73
00:03:28,200 --> 00:03:29,466
and the next audition

74
00:03:30,100 --> 00:03:31,200
I prayed

75
00:03:33,166 --> 00:03:35,966
I prayed and I prayed

76
00:03:38,266 --> 00:03:39,699
but I continue to fail

77
00:03:40,100 --> 00:03:40,933
and fail

78
00:03:41,666 --> 00:03:43,933
and fail but it didn't matter because you know what

79
00:03:44,533 --> 00:03:45,666
there's an old saying

80
00:03:46,166 --> 00:03:48,199
you hang around the barbershop long enough

81
00:03:48,200 --> 00:03:50,100
sooner or lady you're gonna get a haircut

82
00:03:52,300 --> 00:03:53,800
so you will catch a break

83
00:03:53,800 --> 00:03:55,366
and I did catch a break

84
00:03:57,366 --> 00:03:58,366
last year

85
00:03:59,466 --> 00:04:01,733
I did a play called fences on Broadway

86
00:04:02,533 --> 00:04:03,666
but here's the kicker

87
00:04:04,766 --> 00:04:06,499
it was at the court theater

88
00:04:07,700 --> 00:04:09,500
it was at the same theater

89
00:04:09,733 --> 00:04:11,966
that I failed at 1st audition

90
00:04:12,300 --> 00:04:13,500
30 years prior

91
00:04:15,300 --> 00:04:16,300
the point is

92
00:04:16,300 --> 00:04:18,766
every graduate here today has the training

93
00:04:18,866 --> 00:04:21,099
and the talent to succeed

94
00:04:21,500 --> 00:04:24,133
but do you have the guts to fail

95
00:04:26,733 --> 00:04:28,366
if you don't fail

96
00:04:29,200 --> 00:04:30,733
you're not even trying

97
00:04:33,533 --> 00:04:34,466
I'll say it again

98
00:04:34,466 --> 00:04:37,266
if you don't fail you're not even trying

99
00:04:38,933 --> 00:04:41,166
to get something you never had

100
00:04:41,200 --> 00:04:43,966
you have to do something you never did

101
00:04:45,500 --> 00:04:47,466
as imagine you're on your deathbed

102
00:04:47,800 --> 00:04:49,733
and standing around your deathbed

103
00:04:50,066 --> 00:04:53,733
are the ghosts representing your unfulfilled potential

104
00:04:54,533 --> 00:04:57,499
the ghost of the ideas you never acted on

105
00:04:58,066 --> 00:05:00,599
the ghost of the talents you didn't use

106
00:05:01,700 --> 00:05:03,700
and they're standing around your bed

107
00:05:04,400 --> 00:05:05,333
angry

108
00:05:06,000 --> 00:05:08,666
disappointed and upset

109
00:05:12,500 --> 00:05:14,400
they say we we came to you

110
00:05:14,566 --> 00:05:17,499
because you could have brought us to life they say

111
00:05:20,300 --> 00:05:22,700
and now we have to go to the grave together

112
00:05:24,533 --> 00:05:25,966
so I ask you today

113
00:05:27,700 --> 00:05:29,700
how many ghosts are going to be around your bed

114
00:05:29,700 --> 00:05:31,166
when your time comes

115
00:05:43,066 --> 00:05:45,766
I just got back from South Africa's beautiful country

116
00:05:46,466 --> 00:05:48,533
but there are places there with terrible

117
00:05:48,900 --> 00:05:50,300
poverty that need help

118
00:05:51,533 --> 00:05:54,133
an Africa is just the tip of the iceberg

119
00:05:54,200 --> 00:05:55,866
the Middle East needs your help

120
00:05:55,866 --> 00:05:57,399
Japan needs your help

121
00:05:57,400 --> 00:05:59,933
Alabama needs your help Tennessee needs your help

122
00:05:59,933 --> 00:06:01,566
Louisiana needs your help

123
00:06:01,566 --> 00:06:03,266
Philadelphia needs your help

124
00:06:06,900 --> 00:06:09,766
the world needs a lot and we need it from you

125
00:06:10,933 --> 00:06:12,933
we really do we need it from you young people

126
00:06:12,933 --> 00:06:14,899
I mean I'm not speaking for the rest of us up here

127
00:06:14,900 --> 00:06:16,600
but I know I'm getting a little grayer

128
00:06:18,866 --> 00:06:20,499
we need it from you the young people

129
00:06:20,500 --> 00:06:21,733
because remember this

130
00:06:22,333 --> 00:06:23,966
but you gotta get out there

131
00:06:24,300 --> 00:06:25,966
you gotta give it everything you got

132
00:06:25,966 --> 00:06:27,599
whether it's your time

133
00:06:29,000 --> 00:06:32,000
your talent your prayers

134
00:06:32,333 --> 00:06:33,733
or your treasures

135
00:06:36,000 --> 00:06:37,933
what are you going to do with what you have

136
00:06:37,933 --> 00:06:40,066
I'm not talking about how much you have

137
00:06:40,666 --> 00:06:42,099
some of you are business mages

138
00:06:42,100 --> 00:06:44,700
some of you are theologians nurses sociologies

139
00:06:44,800 --> 00:06:46,100
some of you have money

140
00:06:46,100 --> 00:06:47,600
some of you have patience

141
00:06:47,600 --> 00:06:49,066
some of you have kindness

142
00:06:49,066 --> 00:06:50,466
some of you have love

143
00:06:50,500 --> 00:06:53,000
some of you have a gift of long suffering

144
00:06:53,000 --> 00:06:55,266
whatever it is whatever your gift is

145
00:06:55,733 --> 00:06:59,166
what are you going to do with what you have

146
00:07:00,366 --> 00:07:02,533
all right now here's my last point about failure

147
00:07:03,733 --> 00:07:04,933
sometimes

148
00:07:06,100 --> 00:07:07,566
it's the best way

149
00:07:08,933 --> 00:07:10,533
to figure out where you're going

150
00:07:12,133 --> 00:07:14,266
your life will never be a straight path

151
00:07:15,300 --> 00:07:18,066
I began at fordham university as a pre med student

152
00:07:18,466 --> 00:07:20,166
I took a course called that

153
00:07:21,366 --> 00:07:22,599
kandiak morphogenesis

154
00:07:22,600 --> 00:07:24,166
I couldn't read it I couldn't say it

155
00:07:24,166 --> 00:07:25,666
I sure couldn't pass it

156
00:07:26,733 --> 00:07:29,999
so then I decided to go into pre law then journalism

157
00:07:30,100 --> 00:07:31,566
and with no academic focus

158
00:07:31,566 --> 00:07:33,966
my grades took off in their own direction

159
00:07:35,766 --> 00:07:38,099
I was a 1.8 GPA

160
00:07:39,100 --> 00:07:41,566
and the university very politely suggested

161
00:07:41,566 --> 00:07:43,866
that it might be better to take some time off

162
00:07:46,400 --> 00:07:47,866
I was 20 years old

163
00:07:48,100 --> 00:07:49,666
I was at my lowest point

164
00:07:49,966 --> 00:07:52,866
and then one day and I remember the exact day

165
00:07:52,966 --> 00:07:57,499
27/3/1975 I was helping my mother in a beauty shop

166
00:07:57,500 --> 00:07:59,566
my mother in a beauty shop up in my Vernon

167
00:07:59,700 --> 00:08:00,166
and there was

168
00:08:00,166 --> 00:08:01,533
there was this older woman

169
00:08:01,966 --> 00:08:04,566
who was considered one of the elders in the town

170
00:08:04,566 --> 00:08:06,266
and I didn't know her personally

171
00:08:06,266 --> 00:08:07,699
but I was looking in the mirror

172
00:08:07,700 --> 00:08:09,666
and every time I looked at the mirror I could see her

173
00:08:09,700 --> 00:08:11,566
behind me and she was staring at me

174
00:08:12,666 --> 00:08:14,566
she just kept looking at every time I looked at it

175
00:08:14,566 --> 00:08:16,299
she kept giving me these strange looks

176
00:08:16,700 --> 00:08:19,100
so she finally took the dry or off her head and said

177
00:08:19,800 --> 00:08:21,366
she said something I'll never forget

178
00:08:22,400 --> 00:08:23,733
she said young boy

179
00:08:24,166 --> 00:08:25,533
I have a prophecy

180
00:08:26,000 --> 00:08:27,866
a spiritual prophecy

181
00:08:29,466 --> 00:08:32,133
she said you are going to travel the world

182
00:08:32,466 --> 00:08:34,899
and speak to millions of people

183
00:08:37,466 --> 00:08:38,666
and in the years that followed

184
00:08:38,666 --> 00:08:40,399
just as that woman prophesize

185
00:08:40,400 --> 00:08:41,866
I have traveled the world

186
00:08:41,866 --> 00:08:43,966
and I have spoken to millions of people

187
00:08:43,966 --> 00:08:45,133
through my movies

188
00:08:45,800 --> 00:08:47,866
millions who up till this day

189
00:08:48,166 --> 00:08:49,199
couldn't see me

190
00:08:49,200 --> 00:08:52,166
I who who up till this day I couldn't see

191
00:08:52,500 --> 00:08:54,666
while I was talking to them and they couldn't see me

192
00:08:54,666 --> 00:08:55,933
they could only see the movie

193
00:08:56,933 --> 00:08:58,366
it couldn't see the real me

194
00:09:00,466 --> 00:09:02,333
but I see youth today

195
00:09:03,900 --> 00:09:06,133
and I'm encouraged by what I see

196
00:09:07,866 --> 00:09:10,733
and I'm strengthened by what I see

197
00:09:14,200 --> 00:09:17,900
because taking risk is not just about going for a job

198
00:09:18,300 --> 00:09:20,600
it's also about knowing what you know

199
00:09:20,733 --> 00:09:22,166
and what you don't know

200
00:09:22,366 --> 00:09:24,599
it's about being open to people

201
00:09:25,366 --> 00:09:27,066
and two ideas

202
00:09:28,200 --> 00:09:29,566
the chances you take

203
00:09:29,900 --> 00:09:31,400
the people you meet

204
00:09:31,700 --> 00:09:33,266
the people you love

205
00:09:33,666 --> 00:09:35,366
the faith that you have

206
00:09:35,733 --> 00:09:37,766
that's what's going to define you

207
00:09:40,166 --> 00:09:41,533
never be discouraged

208
00:09:42,733 --> 00:09:44,066
never hold back

209
00:09:45,100 --> 00:09:46,600
give everything you got

210
00:09:48,066 --> 00:09:49,933
and when you fall throughout light

211
00:09:50,200 --> 00:09:51,100
remember this

212
00:09:52,766 --> 00:09:53,933
fall forward
